title: If Lands Could Kill
label: Main (30MB audio/mp3)
keywords: versus,magic podcast,noob knowledge,magic  the gathering,novice,video games,tiny leaders,commander podcast,mtg,card game,aquickness,deck tech,magic,mtg podcast
description: If Lands Could Kill is a Magic the Gathering podcast by novices, for novices. Host Knife City along with Ryke, Samhain Crow, and Hot Sauce discuss the meta game, building decks, giving advice to new players, and how not to be a dick. This podcast has explicit language and themes, and that's just the way we like it. Along with the weekly podcast, ILCK provides a series of Deck Techs and booster box opening videos, plus Versus matchups between current tier 1 decks and home brews, all of which can be found at our YouTube channel and website.Visit ourWebsiteLike us onFacebookWatch our other content onYouTubeFollow us onTwitter

title: Magic People

title: Magic the Amateuring
label: Main (30MB audio/mp3)
description: In a world...where Magic the Gathering seems too complicated...two enthusiastic amateur players break it down for the rest of us. Each episode, Maria and Meghan dive face-first into new Magic rules, cards, and strategy. Did we mention they're obsessed with this game? They are. And - if you listen - you will be, too! Unless, much like a Gobbling Ooze, you were born without a soul. Or arms. Or eyes.

title: MTG Focus
label: Main (30MB audio/mp3)
description: We are a news/debate podcast. We will focus on the news of the previous week and then debate the pressing issues in the community each week. We will likely have some of the bigger names in Magic to visit us each week.

title: MTG Pro Tutor
label: Main (30MB audio/mp3)
description: MTG Pro Tutor is the #2 Magic: The Gathering podcast and here's why: professional Magic players and community notables share their origin stories twice a week (Tue & Fri) and impart actionable tips you can use the next time you sit down to play.Learn from the wealth of experience they've built through hours of practice and playing against hundreds of opponents and start seeing improvements in your own skill right away. Don't you hate feeling like you play and play and don’t improve? Surrounding yourself with better players is the best way to level up and the MTG Pro Tutor podcast is your way of doing that.

description: Constructed Criticism is a weekly podcast dedicated to improving your Magic skills – especially in constructed play. We want you to get better through looking at your own game, week in and week out. We, the hosts, are PTQ grinders with a love for the constructed formats. We have a very Spike and Johnny view of Magic and have learned a lot in our time playing. We launched this podcast hoping that we can share that knowledge with you as we learn it.
